title: For-Profit Education Chain Vista College Files for Bankruptcy After Shutdown
sub_head: Chicago private-equity firm Prospect Partners for years has been rolling acquisitions into Vista College, which has campuses in three states
body:
Vista College, a private-equity-backed chain of for-profit business schools with campuses in three states, has filed for chapter 7 bankruptcy after shutting down operations.
The Richardson, Texas-based business is owned by Prospect Partners, a Chicago-based private-equity firm that has acquired for-profit schools for years and put them under the Vista banner.
